messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]  TV: revisited #942
messages.msgSnippet: What if we don t put things in categories and label them?  *:-) If it happens here it s life, that s the only category we have. Buttons (hurriedly scribbling
messages.messageBody:
What if we don't put things in categories and label them? *:-)
If it happens here it's life, that's the only category we have.

Buttons (hurriedly scribbling in her write in vote - "life")

----- Original Message -----
From: Kolleen <Kolleen@...>
To: Unschooling.com <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
> >Buttons wrote:
> >I respond to a message on the list about parents who require things of
> >their children are not real unschoolers and it turns into the great
debate
> >over tv.
>
> This is a great segway to something that crosses my mind.. and I forget
> to bring it up..
>
> Does TV fall into the 'unschooling' or the 'unparenting' category to you?
> (thats a plural to the list you)
>
>
> kolleen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]  TV: revisited #942
messages.msgSnippet: ... An extremely valid point and observation. My objective was to try to clear some of the smoke of an ongoing smouldering and firey debate. Since noboby
messages.messageBody:
>What if we don't put things in categories and label them? *:-)
>If it happens here it's life, that's the only category we have.
>
>Buttons (hurriedly scribbling in her write in vote - "life")


An extremely valid point and observation.

My objective was to try to clear some of the smoke of an ongoing
smouldering and firey debate.

Since noboby argues nearly as much about chores.. since it falls into the
parenting sector... I thought the TV would also... and some of the smoke
would clear.

kolleen
the unschooling unparent

"People take different roads seeking
fulfillment and happiness. Just
because they're not on your road
doesn't mean they've gotten lost."
-H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
